Queensland Government Enterprise Architecture FAIRA Framework

Authors: Queensland Government

This document outlines the FAIRA (Framework for Artificial Intelligence Risk Assessment) framework developed by the Queensland Government as part of its Enterprise Architecture. The framework is designed to provide a structured approach to assessing and mitigating risks associated with the implementation of Artificial Intelligence (AI) within government operations. It consists of three key parts: Part A focuses on components analysis, Part B on values assessment, and Part C on controls for AI risks. The framework‚Äôs completion is intended to support AI governance, compliance, business processes, risk identification and analysis, controls and risk mitigations, skills development, communication, and strategic alignment. The document emphasizes the importance of a collaborative approach, requiring input from a diverse team of experts including technical, policy, subject domain, operational, and accountable officers. It specifically directs users to familiarize themselves with the Queensland Government‚Äôs AI governance policy and guideline, and to consult the National Framework for the Assurance of AI in Government (NFAAIG) 2024 for further context. The framework‚Äôs execution involves conducting collaborative workshops to address identified risks and potentially engaging additional experts as needed. The framework's purpose is to ensure responsible and effective AI adoption, aligning with strategic values and minimizing potential negative impacts. The document highlights the need for a thorough and considered approach to AI risk management, reflecting the complexities and potential consequences of this technology.

Key Concepts:

  • Framework for assessing AI risks within the Queensland Government.
  • Integration of AI governance, compliance, and business processes.
  • Identification and analysis of AI risks, followed by the implementation of controls and mitigations.
  • Automated systems perform administrative decisions without human intervention.
  • AI solutions can convert decisions into actions through programmed tasks and rule application.
  • The benefits of AI solutions include improved stakeholder wellbeing, autonomy, and justice, alongside increased productivity and reduced task fatigue.
artificial intelligence risk assessment FAIRA AI governance risk mitigation Queensland Government NFAAIG administrative decision-making automated systems AI solution
